definition: To accept or tolerate something, often used to describe the act of acknowledging and enduring a situation or circumstance without resistance or objection. It is commonly employed when referring to accepting an unfavorable outcome, an unwelcome change, or an unpleasant reality.

examples.english: I have to accept the decision.

examples.german: Er kann die Kritik nicht hinnehmen.

examples.english: We have to accept the consequences.

examples.german: Sie hat die Niederlage nicht hinnehmen wollen.
examples.english: She didn't want to accept the defeat.
He had to accept the punishment.
